item.title: A New Wireless Hack Can Unlock 100 Million Volkswagens
item.description:
A New Wireless Hack Can Unlock 100 Million Volkswagens

In 2013, when University of Birmingham computer scientist Flavio Garcia and a team of researchers were preparing to reveal a vulnerability that allowed them to start the ignition of millions of Volkswagen cars and drive them off without a key, they were hit with a lawsuit that delayed the publication of their research for two years.

item.title: Facebook for Mobile
item.description:
Facebook for Mobile

Udacity and Facebook now offer classes that teach you how to add the features your app needs to succeed.

item.title: Connected car report 2016: Opportunities, risk, and turmoil on the road to autonomous vehicles
item.description:
Connected car report 2016: Opportunities, risk, and turmoil on the road to autonomous vehicles

The race to build the fully connected car, and ultimately the completely autonomous vehicle, is already underway. Who will cross the finish line successfully - and where exactly that finish line is - remains to be seen.

item.title: Microsoft Office Can Now Verify Docs on the Bitcoin Blockchain
item.description:
Microsoft Office Can Now Verify Docs on the Bitcoin Blockchain

Stampery, which provides verification of documents against both the Bitcoin and Ethereum blockchains, will be accessible for verifying emails without users leaving Outlook itself. "Stampery provides this functionality today by creating hashes of documents submitted through the web and storing them on the Ethereum and Bitcoin public blockchains.

item.title: Nvidia says deep learning is about to revolutionize medicine
item.description:
Nvidia says deep learning is about to revolutionize medicine

The chip maker Nvidia is riding the current artificial-intelligence boom with hardware designed to power cutting-edge learning algorithms. And the company sees health care and medicine as the next big market for its technology. Kimberly Powell, who leads Nvidia's efforts in health care, says the company is working with medical researchers in a range of areas and will look to expand these efforts in coming years.

item.title: 15 venture capital funds to know if you're working on a machine intelligence startup
item.description:
15 venture capital funds to know if you're working on a machine intelligence startup

Major tech trends tend to draw lots of "dumb money" from investors and machine intelligence is no exception. Some will lose money on insignificant acquihires while others may survive long enough to see their investments die at the hands of open source.

item.title: There's a big problem with AI: even its creators can't explain how it works
item.description:
There's a big problem with AI: even its creators can't explain how it works

Last year, a strange self-driving car was released onto the quiet roads of Monmouth County, New Jersey. The experimental vehicle, developed by researchers at the chip maker Nvidia, didn't look different from other autonomous cars, but it was unlike anything demonstrated by Google, Tesla, or General Motors, and it showed the rising power of artificial intelligence.

item.title: Robotics Nanodegree
item.description:
Robotics Nanodegree

Learn to build robotics software solutions for growing industries using techniques such as computer vision, machine learning, AI, and hardware actuation.

item.title: Blockchain
item.description:
Blockchain

Blockchain has been called 'the next generation of the internet', a powerful set of technologies forecasted to disrupt centuries-old systems of record-keeping. But what is it, how will it change the way we interact, and what does Airbus contribute to the new conversation in which the word on everyone's lips is 'trust'?

item.title: Internet of Things Security Solutions - ForeScout
item.description:
Internet of Things Security Solutions - ForeScout

By 2020 there will be 30 billion connected devices-20 billion of which will be IoT devices that are prone to security attacks. Securing them will be key to your organization's success and it begins with agentless visibility. Before IoT there were 3.5X more devices than the number of employees in an organization With IoT that's expected to go up to 10X.
